comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] The NSW (O) 60-class entered service between October 1874 and January 1875. Built in England by Stephenson's and erected locally by Mort and Company, Sydney.  No 62 entered service in December 1874 and was withdrawn in 1889 having travelled 593,521 miles in the service of the state.

The locomotive was sold  in April 1897 to the Newcastle Sand Company.
